DataElement.preferredName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health Problems Missing Work Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how many days they have missed from work because of health problems.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health Health Problems Missing Work Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The second version of a standardized survey originally developed by Margaret C. Reilly in 1993 which is used to evaluate the extent to which a patient's general health problems effects their ability to work and perform daily activities. This instrument consists of 6 questions which can be completed by the patient or in an interview format._The most recent week, including today_Not existing; not able to be found._The principal activity that a person does to earn money._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The second version of a standardized survey originally developed by Margaret C. Reilly in 1993 which is used to evaluate the extent to which a patient's general health problems effects their ability to work and perform daily activities. This instrument consists of 6 questions which can be completed by the patient or in an interview format.

Concepts.longName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: The second version of a standardized survey originally developed by Margaret C. Reilly in 1993 which is used to evaluate the extent to which a patient's general health problems effects their ability to work and perform daily activities. This instrument consists of 6 questions which can be completed by the patient or in an interview format.

The principal activity that a person does to earn money.
